thread.title: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal have a ‘mental problem’ against big teams
thread.title_full: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal have a ‘mental problem’ against big teams

author: leeastley
title: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal have a ‘mental problem’ against big teams
text:
Comments LAURENT KOSCIELNY has admitted Arsenal have a “mental problem” when it comes to facing the big teams. 
The Gunners were level with Bayern Munich at half-time in their Champions League clash against Bayern Munich but were then thumped 5-1. PA:Press Association Arsenal were embarrassed 5-1 by Bayern Munich in the Champions League last week Bayern Munich players celebrate on the pitch after Arsenal Champions League rout 
And defender Koscielny has urged his team-mates to develop a hatred of losing if they are to succeed in winning any silverware. 
Koscielny said: "We have up and down results. It's a mental problem. 
"We have the technical and physical qualities. We have to make an effort for the whole game. 
"Against big teams you need more than talent. It takes more commitment, helping your teammates to defend. 
"You have to find other reserves. 
"In certain games we lacked the knack, determination in challenges. We're in a difficult situation and we have to stick together. We have to hate losing." Getty Images Laurent Koscielny was injured and taken off against Bayern Munich which led to their implosion Getty Images 4 Laurent Koscielny hopes to be back in time to face Liverpool on March 4 
Koscielny came off injured in the embarrassing loss in Germany with a thigh problem but hopes to be fit in time for the game. 
And the French international insisted under-fire Gunners boss Arsene Wenger has the total backing of the squad. Wenger says Arsenal lost organisation in 5-1 beating by Bayern Munich related stories Mesut Ozil attracting interest from Chinese Super League as he dithers on new Arsenal contract Sam slams Gunners Samir Nasri insists Arsenal players must take the blame for failure... not under-fire Arsene Wenger Gunner get Roo Arsenal should make shock bid to sign China-bound Wayne Rooney, according to Harry Redknapp Gunning for Gibbs Danny Welbeck reveals he used to 'hate' Arsenal and England team-mate Kieran Gibbs when he played against him for Manchester United bren gun Ray Parlour believes Celtic's Brendan Rodgers could be the man to replace Arsene Wenger as Arsenal boss AP:Associated Press Laurent Koscielny says Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger has the full support of the players 
Koscielny added: "I think the squad is still receptive to his message. 
"The coach is there to prepare the players physically, tactically and organise things on the pitch. After that, it's up to the players to do what is needed on the pitch to win games. 
"I'd like him to extend his contract. I've played for seven years under him and I have huge respect for him. I owe him a lot for my career." Sutton United 0-2 Arsenal : Sutton’s magical FA Cup run is ended in gritty encounter
